techmeme.title: Naspers and Prosus CEO Fabricio Bloisi says he is overhauling corporate culture and pay structures in search of growth beyond Prosus' stake in Tencent (Financial Times)
Paris-based Filigran, which develops open-source threat intelligence platform OpenCTI used by the EU, the FBI, and more, raised a $35M Series B led by Insight (Romain Dillet/TechCrunch)
Banks and regulators warn of a rise in QR code phishing scams, which experts say are commonly deployed in emails to get through corporate cyber security filters (Stephanie Stacey/Financial Times)
Indonesia bans the sale of the iPhone 16 series, claiming that Apple has not fulfilled its 40% local content requirements and hasn't met investment commitments (Claire Jiao/Bloomberg)
Elon Musk says there's a "chance" that HW3, in millions of Teslas, "does not achieve the safety level that allows for unsupervised FSD" and floats free upgrades (Fred Lambert/Electrek)
